review_title: Admin/Mgmt seem to have forgotten what it’s like to work in the trenches
job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Angelo, TX
pros: Well, we get solid hours. Also full time gets insurance. Some of the hardest working people I’ve ever seen as coworkers who really care about people.

job_title: Information Technology in San Angelo, TX
pros: Some good people still left.
cons:
Overworked
Underpaid
Admin fails to listen to reason.
Growing fast which leads to major increase in workloads with no compensation or compassion for current staff. 
Doctors are able to treat staff horribly and nothing is done, any HR complaints would fall on deaf ears. 
Passive aggressive / hostile work environment if you don't complain about workload. 
High turnover which leads to increased workloads where no compensation is given. 
Reliable employees overworked to the point of depression and stress and hate coming to work. 
Almost impossible to get a raise, claim they are current with market research but are well below. 
Remote work is frowned upon and rarely allowed. 
Vacation time is acquired slowly and not that you can hardly take time off anyway without getting forced to work on PTO. 
CEO is an accountant, the care for numbers only is evident.
